trans-unit.source: Create and load data into Hive tables from Blob storage | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create and load data into Hive tables from Blob storage | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Create Hive tables and load data in blob to hive tables
trans-unit.target: Create Hive tables and load data in blob to hive tables

trans-unit.source: In this document, generic Hive queries that create Hive tables and load data from Azure blob storage are presented.
trans-unit.target: In this document, generic Hive queries that create Hive tables and load data from Azure blob storage are presented.

trans-unit.source: These Hive queries are shared in the GitHub repository.
trans-unit.target: These Hive queries are shared in the GitHub repository.

trans-unit.source: [Github repository](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-MachineLearning-DataScience/tree/master/Misc/DataScienceProcess/DataScienceScripts/samplehivecreatedbtblsloaddata_generic.hql).
trans-unit.target: [Github repository](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-MachineLearning-DataScience/tree/master/Misc/DataScienceProcess/DataScienceScripts/samplehivecreatedbtblsloaddata_generic.hql).

trans-unit.source: If you create an Azure virtual machine by following the instructions in "Set Up an Azure Virtual Machine with IPython Notebook Server", this script file has been downloaded to the C:\Users\\Documents\Data Science Scripts directory on the virtual machine. You need to plug in your own data schema and Azure blob storage configuration in the corresponding fields in these queries and these Hive queries should be ready for submission.
trans-unit.target: If you create an Azure virtual machine by following the instructions in "Set Up an Azure Virtual Machine with IPython Notebook Server", this script file has been downloaded to the C:\Users\\Documents\Data Science Scripts directory on the virtual machine. You need to plug in your own data schema and Azure blob storage configuration in the corresponding fields in these queries and these Hive queries should be ready for submission.

trans-unit.source: We assume that the data for Hive tables is in uncompressed tabular format, and the data has been uploaded to the default or additional container of the storage account used by the Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: We assume that the data for Hive tables is in uncompressed tabular format, and the data has been uploaded to the default or additional container of the storage account used by the Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: If users want to practice on the NYC Taxi Trip Data, they need to first download all 24 files (12 Trip files, and 12 Fair files), unzip all files into .csv files, and upload them to the default or additional container of the Azure storage account that are used when the Azure HDInsight Hadoop cluster is customized.
trans-unit.target: If users want to practice on the NYC Taxi Trip Data, they need to first download all 24 files (12 Trip files, and 12 Fair files), unzip all files into .csv files, and upload them to the default or additional container of the Azure storage account that are used when the Azure HDInsight Hadoop cluster is customized.

trans-unit.source: Hive queries can be submitted in the Hadoop Command Line on the head node of the Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: Hive queries can be submitted in the Hadoop Command Line on the head node of the Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: You need to:
trans-unit.target: You need to:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable remote access to the head node of the Hadoop cluster, and log on to the head node</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable remote access to the head node of the Hadoop cluster, and log on to the head node</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Submit the Hive queries in the Hadoop Command Line on the head node</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Submit the Hive queries in the Hadoop Command Line on the head node</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Users can also use [Query Console (Hive Editor)] by entering the URL in a web browser `https://<Hadoop cluster name>.azurehdinsight.net/Home/HiveEditor (you will be asked to input the Hadoop cluster credentials to log in), or can <linkText>submit Hive jobs using PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Users can also use [Query Console (Hive Editor)] by entering the URL in a web browser `https://<Hadoop cluster name>.azurehdinsight.net/Home/HiveEditor (you will be asked to input the Hadoop cluster credentials to log in), or can <linkText>submit Hive jobs using PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Step 1: Create Hive database and tables</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Step 1: Create Hive database and tables</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Step 2: Load data to Hive tables</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Step 2: Load data to Hive tables</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Advanced topics: partitioned table and store Hive data in ORC format</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Advanced topics: partitioned table and store Hive data in ORC format</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Here are the descriptions of the fields that users need to plug in and other configurations:
trans-unit.target: Here are the descriptions of the fields that users need to plug in and other configurations:

trans-unit.source: : the name of the database users want to create. If users just want to use the default database, the query create database... can be omitted.
trans-unit.target: : the name of the database users want to create. If users just want to use the default database, the query create database... can be omitted.

trans-unit.source:
: the name of the table users want to create within the specified database. If users want to use the default database, the table can be directly referred by
without ..
trans-unit.target:
: the name of the table users want to create within the specified database. If users want to use the default database, the table can be directly referred by
without ..

trans-unit.source: : the separator that separates fields in the data file to be uploaded to the Hive table.
trans-unit.target: : the separator that separates fields in the data file to be uploaded to the Hive table.

trans-unit.source: : the separator that separates lines in the data file.
trans-unit.target: : the separator that separates lines in the data file.

trans-unit.source: : the Azure storage location to save the data of Hive tables. If users do not specify LOCATION '', by default the database and the tables are stored in hive/warehouse/ directory in the default container of the Hive cluster. If a user wants to specify the storage location, the storage location has to be within the default container for the database and tables. This location has to be referred as relative location to the default container of the cluster in the format of 'wasb:////' or 'wasb://///', etc. After the query is executed, the relative directories will be created within the default container.
trans-unit.target: : the Azure storage location to save the data of Hive tables. If users do not specify LOCATION '', by default the database and the tables are stored in hive/warehouse/ directory in the default container of the Hive cluster. If a user wants to specify the storage location, the storage location has to be within the default container for the database and tables. This location has to be referred as relative location to the default container of the cluster in the format of 'wasb:////' or 'wasb://///', etc. After the query is executed, the relative directories will be created within the default container.

trans-unit.source: TBLPROPERTIES("skip.header.line.count"="1"): If the data file has a header line, users have to add this property at the end of the create table query.
trans-unit.target: TBLPROPERTIES("skip.header.line.count"="1"): If the data file has a header line, users have to add this property at the end of the create table query.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the header line will be loaded as a record to the table.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the header line will be loaded as a record to the table.

trans-unit.source: If the data file does not have a header line, this configuration can be omitted in the query.
trans-unit.target: If the data file does not have a header line, this configuration can be omitted in the query.

trans-unit.source: : If the blob file to be uploaded to Hive table is in the default container of the HDInsight Hadoop cluster, the should be in the format 'wasb:////'. The blob file can also be in the additional container of the HDInsight Hadoop cluster. In this case, should be in the format 'wasb://@.blob.windows.core.net/'.
trans-unit.target: : If the blob file to be uploaded to Hive table is in the default container of the HDInsight Hadoop cluster, the should be in the format 'wasb:////'. The blob file can also be in the additional container of the HDInsight Hadoop cluster. In this case, should be in the format 'wasb://@.blob.windows.core.net/'.

trans-unit.source: The blob data to be uploaded to Hive table has to be in the default or additional container of the storage account for the Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: The blob data to be uploaded to Hive table has to be in the default or additional container of the storage account for the Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the LOAD DATA query will fail complaining that it cannot access the data.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the LOAD DATA query will fail complaining that it cannot access the data.

trans-unit.source: If the data is large, partitioning the table will be beneficial for queries that only need to scan a few partitions of the table.
trans-unit.target: If the data is large, partitioning the table will be beneficial for queries that only need to scan a few partitions of the table.

trans-unit.source: For instance, it is reasonable to partition the log data of a web site by dates.
trans-unit.target: For instance, it is reasonable to partition the log data of a web site by dates.

trans-unit.source: In addition to partition the table, it is also beneficial to store the Hive data in ORC format.
trans-unit.target: In addition to partition the table, it is also beneficial to store the Hive data in ORC format.

trans-unit.source: ORC stands for "Optimized Row Columnar".
trans-unit.target: ORC stands for "Optimized Row Columnar".

trans-unit.source: Please refer to "[Using ORC files improves performance when Hive is reading, writing, and processing data](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/LanguageManual+ORC#LanguageManualORC-ORCFiles)." for more details.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to "[Using ORC files improves performance when Hive is reading, writing, and processing data](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/LanguageManual+ORC#LanguageManualORC-ORCFiles)." for more details.

trans-unit.source: The queries of creating a partitioned table and loading data to it are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The queries of creating a partitioned table and loading data to it are as follows:

trans-unit.source: When querying partitioned tables, it is recommended to add the partition condition in the beginning of the where clause so that the searching efficacy can be significantly improved.
trans-unit.target: When querying partitioned tables, it is recommended to add the partition condition in the beginning of the where clause so that the searching efficacy can be significantly improved.

trans-unit.source: Users cannot directly load data in blob to Hive tables in ORC storage format.
trans-unit.target: Users cannot directly load data in blob to Hive tables in ORC storage format.

trans-unit.source: Here are the steps that the users need to take in order to load data from Azure blobs to Hive tables stored in ORC format.
trans-unit.target: Here are the steps that the users need to take in order to load data from Azure blobs to Hive tables stored in ORC format.

trans-unit.source: Create an external table STORED AS TEXTFILE and load data from blob storage to the table.
trans-unit.target: Create an external table STORED AS TEXTFILE and load data from blob storage to the table.

trans-unit.source: Create an internal table with the same schema as the external table in step 1, and the same field delimiter.
trans-unit.target: Create an internal table with the same schema as the external table in step 1, and the same field delimiter.

trans-unit.source: And store the Hive data in the ORC format
trans-unit.target: And store the Hive data in the ORC format

trans-unit.source: Select data from the external table in step 1 and insert into the ORC table
trans-unit.target: Select data from the external table in step 1 and insert into the ORC table

trans-unit.source: If the TEXTFILE table . has partitions, in STEP 3, SELECT * FROM . will select the partition variable as a field in the returned data set. Inserting it to the . will fail since . does not have the partition variable as a field in the table schema. In this case, users need to specifically select the fields to be inserted to . like follows:
trans-unit.target: If the TEXTFILE table . has partitions, in STEP 3, SELECT * FROM . will select the partition variable as a field in the returned data set. Inserting it to the . will fail since . does not have the partition variable as a field in the table schema. In this case, users need to specifically select the fields to be inserted to . like follows:

trans-unit.source: It is safe to drop the using the following query after all data has been inserted into .:
trans-unit.target: It is safe to drop the using the following query after all data has been inserted into .:

trans-unit.source: Now we have a table with data in the ORC format ready to use.
trans-unit.target: Now we have a table with data in the ORC format ready to use.
